title: Inside the Micah Parsons trade: How things fell apart in Dallas, and why Green Bay moved quickly
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: Agent: Parsons' first choice was 'to be a Cowboy'
content: Micah Parsons "wanted to be a Cowboy" and, had he not been traded to the Packers, would've played in the season opener rather than sit out, his agent told ESPN.

title: Hall of Fame basketball coach Raveling dies at 88
content: George Raveling, a Hall of Fame basketball coach who played a role in Michael Jordan signing a landmark endorsement deal with Nike, has died. He was 88.

title: Giants unofficially list Dart as Wilson's backup
content: Rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart is listed ahead of veteran Jameis Winston heading into the Giants' season opener against the Washington Commanders.

title: Belichick: Heels 'better than what we were tonight'
content: TCU spoiled Bill Belichick's college coaching debut by rolling past North Carolina 48-14 on Monday night.

title: Two-time IndyCar champ Power out at Penske
content: Ending a year of speculation, it was announced Tuesday that Will Power would not be returning to Team Penske for an 18th season.

title: Pads reliever Adam suffers ruptured quad tendon
content: All-Star reliever Jason Adam was carted off the field after getting injured in the seventh inning of the Padres' loss to the Orioles on Monday.

title: Gundy calls out Ducks' budget; Lanning fires back
content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy and Oregon's Dan Lanning traded barbs Monday after Gundy called attention to the Ducks' sizable budget.

title: Venus in doubles last 8, calls on Serena to show up
content: Venus Williams and Leylah Fernandez reached the women's doubles quarterfinals at the US Open, defeating the 12th-seeded duo of Ekaterina Alexandrova and Zhang Shuai 6-3, 6-4 in their third-round match Monday.

title: Over 1,400 dead: Why 6.0 earthquake in Afghanistan claimed so many lives
content: A devastating 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, resulting in over 1,400 deaths and 3,000 injuries in Kunar province alone. The shallow depth of the quake and vulnerable mud-brick homes contributed to the high casualty rate. This disaster compounds Afghanistan's existing crises, including reduced aid funding and a struggling economy, hindering rescue and relief efforts.

title: 'Little bit of geopolitical issues': Goyal says India-US trade deal likely 'by Nov or so'
content: India and the US are currently engaged in negotiations for a Bilateral Trade Agreement, despite recent tariff impositions by the US and concerns over India's trade relations with Russia. India has set firm boundaries, particularly regarding its agricultural and dairy sectors.

title: Explained: How 5-yr-old became youngest female with FIDE ratings across chess formats
content: Aarini Lahoty, a five-year-old chess prodigy from Delhi, has achieved a remarkable feat by earning FIDE ratings in classical, rapid, and blitz chess formats. She is the youngest girl globally to achieve this milestone and the first Indian player born in 2019 to do so. She now holds ratings of 1553 (classical), 1550 (rapid) and 1498 (blitz).

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college: Parents reaction; money lessons
content: Lucy Guo, the world's youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her early entrepreneurial spirit to her frugal upbringing. Despite her parents' emphasis on academics, she dropped out of Carnegie Mellon to pursue the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's childhood hustles, from selling Pok√©mon cards to creating online gaming tools, laid the foundation for her success with companies like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Maratha quota stir: Apology in court & then a win for Jarange - how it unfolded
content: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange declared victory after the Maharashtra government accepted key demands, including Kunbi caste certificates for eligible Marathas. Celebrations erupted in Mumbai as Jarange ended his hunger strike. The government issued a resolution on the Hyderabad Gazetteer and will form committees to verify Kunbi caste claims.

title: Indian Football: SC order directs AIFF to invite bids for new partners
content: The Supreme Court has directed the AIFF to initiate measures for the upcoming football season, including issuing tenders for new commercial partners to conduct the Indian Super League. This order aims to resolve the uncertainty that arose after the previous contract with FSDL ended, impacting player salaries and pre-season training.

title: Meta Al reshuffle: Head Alexandr Wang sends memo to staff; Makes one thing clear
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: Musk warns against contraceptives: Study links to brain changes
content: Elon Musk's recent post on X has ignited a global discussion. The post relates to a study on hormonal contraceptives. The study suggests possible effects on brain function. It also mentions emotional regulation and memory. Concerns are rising about underestimated medication side effects. The side effects particularly affect women. Experts call for more research and clearer communication.

title: Trademark fight in India: Bombay HC to Cognizant; You cannot use logo till case ends
content: The Bombay High Court has reinstated a ban on Cognizant's use of its logo in India, pending the resolution of a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Atyati Technologies. This decision overturns a previous order that had allowed Cognizant to continue using the logo.

title: Kim arrives in Beijing; to attend military parade alongside Putin, Xi
content: Kim Jong Un arrived in Beijing for a military parade. He will attend with Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin. This marks Kim's first multilateral event. Meetings between Kim and Putin are under consideration. North Korea has been aiding Russia in the Ukraine war. Kim seeks to strengthen ties with China.

title: Micah Parsons FaceTimes heartbroken Cowboys fan, vows to make him proud
content: After a shocking trade sent Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers, a young Cowboys fan's emotional reaction went viral. Parsons responded with empathy, FaceTiming the child, offering encouragement, and promising a Packers jersey. Green Bay then signed Parsons to a record-breaking contract, setting the stage for his return to Dallas as a Packer.

title: Paulina Gretzky stuns in gothic look on Italy trip with Dustin Johnson
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of Wayne Gretzky and wife of Dustin Johnson, is making waves with her daring all-black ensemble during her Italian getaway. Showcasing her evolving style on the LTK app, Gretzky's look features a mix of edgy and luxury pieces, including a Helsa Poplin Bra and Bottega Veneta mules.

title: Brittany Mahomes: Some women are disrespectful pursuing Patrick
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has addressed her past insecurities regarding attention from other women towards her husband. She admitted that disrespectful behavior from some women used to bother her. However, Brittany has grown to a point where she is unbothered and focused on her family with Patrick, whom she met in high school.

title: Hilarious! 'Wo 14 saal ka hi hai ki nahi?': Nitish Rana on Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old cricketing sensation, has taken the IPL 2025 season by storm, smashing a record-breaking century off just 38 balls. His incredible feat made him the youngest player to achieve this milestone in IPL history, securing the second-fastest century, only behind Chris Gayle. Nitish Rana humorously questioned Suryavanshi's age, highlighting the disbelief surrounding the teenager's exceptional talent.

title: 'One-sided' trade myth: Why Donald Trump is wrong - How US profits big from India
content: Donald Trump's claims of a disastrous trade relationship with India are challenged by a GTRI analysis, revealing a $35-40 billion surplus for the US when considering all earnings. The US benefits significantly from tech, finance, and education sectors in India. India's proposed tariff concessions are generous, and its decisions on oil and defence are based on national interests.

title: BRS suspends K Kavitha: Why KCR removed daughter from party; family feud explained
content: K Kavitha, daughter of K Chandrashekar Rao, has been suspended from the BRS after publicly criticising her cousins, T Harish Rao and Santosh Kumar, for allegedly tarnishing her father's image in connection with the Kaleshwaram project. Weeks before, Kavitha was removed as honorary president of the Telangana Boggu Gani Karmika Sangham. Kavitha said it was a political conspiracy as the internal crisis was deepening.

title: Los Angeles Lakers coach claims Luka Doncic, LeBron James improved in each other‚Äôs company
content: Luka Doncic is showing great improvement. He is working with LeBron James. James and Doncic inspire each other. Doncic was traded to the Los Angeles Lakers. His coach says Doncic has learned from great players. James is also working hard. Doncic's physical condition was a concern for Mavericks officials. Doncic will return for the new NBA season in better shape.

title: Who is Brittany Renner? Everything about PJ Washington's ex-girlfriend
content: P.J. Washington, the Dallas Mavericks star, was involved in a heated altercation with his former girlfriend, Brittany Renner, during a custody exchange. The viral video captured Washington's outburst following a remark made by Renner. Renner, a social media personality, fitness model, and influencer, shares a child with Washington, whom she met in early 2020.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Death toll crosses 1,400; rescuers scramble for survivors
content: A devastating 6.0 magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has claimed over 1,400 lives and injured more than 3,100, according to a Taliban government spokesman. The quake, which struck late Sunday, destroyed thousands of homes in Kunar province. Rescue efforts are hampered by difficult terrain.

title: BCCI invites bids to become Indian teams' title sponsors; what's allowed, what's not
content: Following Dream11's exit due to the real money gaming ban, the BCCI seeks a new title sponsor for the Indian cricket team. Bids are invited, excluding companies involved in real money gaming, cryptocurrency, tobacco, and alcohol. The deadline for submissions is September 16.

title: Abuse row: PM Modi‚Äôs emotional outburst against RJD & Congress - 'what did my mother do?'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded strongly to alleged abuses against his late mother during a Congress-RJD rally in Bihar, stating it insulted all women. He expressed that the people of Bihar shared his pain and condemned the remarks. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar also criticized the incident, calling the language used against PM Modi and his mother "utterly deplorable."

title: Discount grows: Russian crude gets even cheaper for India; New Delhi continues to resist US pressure
content: India is facing increased pressure from the US over its growing Russian oil imports, leading to a 50% tariff imposed by the Trump administration. Despite widening discounts on Russian Urals crude, making it cheaper than US alternatives, the US accuses India of funding Russia's war in Ukraine through these purchases.

title: 'Head of anaconda': Ashwin hits out at Lalit Modi over Harbhajan-Sreesanth slapgate video
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has criticized Lalit Modi and Michael Clarke for circulating an old video of the 2008 IPL 'slapgate' incident involving Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth. Ashwin emphasized the importance of moving on from past mistakes, noting that Harbhajan and Sreesanth have already reconciled. The resurfaced footage has been widely condemned, including by Sreesanth's wife, for reigniting a settled controversy.

title: 'Anti-party conduct': BRS suspends K Kavitha - what party said
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) suspended MLC K Kavitha, daughter of KCR, following her public criticism of senior leaders. Kavitha accused T. Harish Rao and J. Santosh Kumar of corruption and tarnishing KCR's image, particularly concerning the Kaleshwaram irrigation project. She alleged their involvement in misdeeds that have defamed her father.

title: Asia Cup: How much do tickets for India vs Pak match cost? How to buy tickets?
content: Asia Cup 2025 ticket sales have officially commenced on Platinumlist, offering fans a chance to secure their seats for the tournament in Dubai and Abu Dhabi. Several package options are available, including group-stage matches, Super Four contests, and the final, alongside individual match tickets. The competition gets underway on September 9.

title: 2020 Delhi riots case: HC rejects bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, 7 others
content: The Delhi High Court has dismissed the bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, and seven others in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots larger conspiracy case. The prosecution argued the violence was a planned conspiracy to defame India, not spontaneous riots.

title: Exclusive | 'I tried to live as a man but': First-ever trans chess player to reach WIM
content: Yosha Iglesias, once a chess prodigy in Sochi, Russia, has made history as the first transgender woman to win the French women's chess championship. Overcoming personal struggles, including a difficult transition and online harassment, Yosha found strength in her chess community and Buddhist philosophy. Her journey, marked by resilience and self-acceptance, inspires others to embrace their true selves.

title: Yamuna threatens Delhi: Floodwaters enter homes; traffic advisory issued
content: The Yamuna River in Delhi has breached the danger mark due to continuous heavy rainfall, leading to waterlogging and flooding in areas like Mayur Vihar. Authorities have closed the Old Iron Bridge and are conducting rescue operations in Burari, evacuating stranded farmers. Shopkeepers in Civil Lines are taking precautions due to rising water levels.

title: 'Put it in container': Pak defence minister‚Äôs solution for floods; calls excess water 'blessing'
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif suggested citizens store floodwater as a blessing amid severe flooding in Punjab province, which has claimed 33 lives and displaced over 700,000 residents. Punjab is experiencing its biggest flood in history, impacting two million people and threatening food security due to crop damage. Monsoon rains have been excessive, leading to widespread devastation across the country.

title: Meet Kittammal V: TN grandma breaking powerlifting records, praised by Anand Mahindra
content: Anand Mahindra lauded Kittammal V, an 82-year-old powerlifter from Tamil Nadu, for her remarkable achievements in state-level competitions. Defying age stereotypes, she inspires many by outperforming younger athletes with her dedication to fitness and a traditional South Indian diet. Her story highlights the importance of resilience and challenges conventional views on aging in India.

title: 'I want my ‚Ä¶': Taylor's interview leaves fans convinced she manifested future with Kelce
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's engagement has fans revisiting a 2012 interview where Swift detailed her vision of love and marriage. Her past words about prioritizing mutual dreams and open communication resonate deeply with her current relationship. Fans are celebrating how her teenage ideals seem to be aligning with her real-life romance with the Kansas City Chiefs star.

title: US Open: Naomi Osaka turns pain into power, fashion into flair at Flushing Meadows
content: Naomi Osaka has lit up the US Open with both style and substance, dazzling in crystal-studded outfits and her quirky ‚Äúlabubus‚Äù plush toys while storming into her first Grand Slam quarter-final in over four years. Defeating Coco Gauff in straight sets, the four-time major champion has embraced motherhood, mental health battles, and a joyful comeback on her beloved Arthur Ashe Stadium.

title: PM Modi rides Xi‚Äôs favourite Hongqi during China visit: Here‚Äôs what makes it special
content: The Hongqi L5 draws power from a massive 6.0-litre V12, delivering more than 400 hp. Despite its size, the car manages a 0‚Äì100 km/h sprint in around 8.5 seconds and tops out at nearly 210 km/h.NAt over 5.5 metres long and weighing upward of three tonnes

title: Jitesh Sharma Exclusive: A small-town boy, who keeps and is blooming in finisher's role
content: Jitesh Sharma scored only 261 runs in Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) title-winning season, but it was not the runs that caught the selectors‚Äô eyes, it was his 176.35 strike rate while batting at 6 and 7. Jitesh, who never had a coach, learnt cricket by watching YouTube videos of his childhood heroes Adam Gilchrist and Sourav Ganguly. Making a comeback into the Indian team at the age of 31 is as breathtaking as his cricketing sojourn.

content: Use of ethanol-blended petrol (E-20) is causing mechanical issues in the functioning of fuel system, including carburettor and engine, of vehicles

content: The party urges the State Election Commission to conduct polls to local bodies every five years without fail

content: Aimed at enhancing interoperability and mutual understanding, the exercise is part of the ongoing military-to-military exchange programme between the two nations

content: The visit will include professional exchanges, cross-deck visits, and joint training with Seychelles Defence Forces personnel

content: The alerts were routed to Islamabad through the Ministry of External Affairs on "humanitarian grounds", sources told PTI

content: Islamic scholars from both traditional and reformist backgrounds caution Muslim community against participating in Onam celebrations.  However, the youth on campuses were in high spirits, immersing themselves in festivities with gusto. They revel in traditional dress, music, dance, games and the festive feast served on banana leaves

content: quarterback's back soreness isn't impacting his expectations for the Rams, coach says . he is entering his fifth season in los angeles . the team is hoping to host the Houston Texans to open the season on sunday .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Man Stabs 5 In France's Marseille, Shot Dead By Police
content: Five people, including a hotel manager and the manager's son, were stabbed at a hotel in the southern French city of Marseille on Tuesday and one was in critical condition, the city's prosecutor said.

title: "Sister-In-law Living Separately Won't Fall Within Ambit Of Family": Allahabad High Court
content: Deciding a dispute regarding the appointment of an anganwadi worker, the Allahabad High Court has observed that a sister-in-law living separately will not fall within the ambit of family.

title: Man Acquitted In Sexual Assault Case, His Relieved Mother Collapses In Court
content: A special court in Maharashtra's Thane district has acquitted a 28-year-old man in a sexual assault case involving a minor girl after he spent five years in jail.

title: 'We'll Get Your Delivery Done Elsewhere': MLA's Shocker After Journalist's Hospital Question
content: Informed by a journalist that people, especially pregnant women, were facing difficulty without a hospital in the area, a Karnataka Congress MLA made a remark that has left many shocked.

title: Judge Refuses To Hear Mining Scam Petition, Says BJP MLA Tried To Influence
content: In a stunning disclosure that has shaken Madhya Pradesh's corridors of power, the High Court has put on record what is usually whispered behind closed doors: That a ruling party MLA tried to sway the bench.

title: "Government Of Misery": EPS Targets DMK With Corruption Charges In Madurai
content: AIADMK General Secretary and Leader of Opposition in the Tamil Nadu Assembly Edappadi K Palaniswami sharpened his offensive against the ruling DMK on Monday.

title: Constitute Authority, Set Rules For New Gaming Law To Work: Delhi High Court
content: The Delhi High Court directed the Centre to constitute an authority and promulgate the rules for the newly-enacted Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Act to work.

title: Cots Float, Families Wade Through Water As Yamuna Levels Rise In Delhi
content: Cots floated in murky floodwater, while families waded through knee-deep currents, balancing their hard-earned belongings on their heads.

title: Patients At Karnataka Government Hospitals To Get Tailor-Made, Scientific Meals: Minister
content: Government hospitals in Karnataka will now provide scientifically designed, patient-specific meals, aimed at improving recovery and overall care, Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao has said.

title: "5-Year Jail Without Trial Itself Grounds For Bail": Umar Khalid's Partner
content: The Supreme Court is the only option left, Umar Khalid's partner said on Tuesday after the high court rejected the bail plea of the activist who has been in jail since September 2020 in a conspiracy case linked to the northeast Delhi riots.

title: Adani Ports Delivers Record Cargo Performance, Boosts Gujarat's Role In Maritime Economy
content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd., India's largest integrated transport utility, reported a 16% year-on-year growth in cargo volumes for August 2025

title: How Long Queues, Dirty Washrooms May Soon Cost Airports
content: Airports across India may soon be rewarded based on how clean their washrooms are, how fast baggage arrives, and how long passengers wait at check-in, security or immigration. And, conversely, deficiencies could lead to penalties.

title: Yamuna River Surges Past Danger Mark, Evacuation, Relief Plans At The Ready
content: For the first time since the devastating floods of 2023, the Yamuna river crossed the 206-metre mark in Delhi on Tuesday afternoon, triggering a city-wide flood preparedness review.

title: Adani Electricity Mumbai Buys Back Bonds Worth $44.66 Million 6 Years Ahead Of Maturity
content: Adani Electricity Mumbai on Tuesday said it has bought back senior secured notes worth $44.66 million six years ahead of their maturity as part of the company's capital management plan.

title: "Manoj Jarange Patil Took Back Movement": Eknath Shinde On Maratha Quota
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said today that quota was a long-standing demand of the Marathas and was there even when he was the Chief Minister.

title: Over 400 Glacial Lakes Expanding, Need "Vigorous Monitoring": Central Water Body
content: More than 400 glacial lakes within India are showing worrying expansion trends and demand vigorous monitoring for disaster purposes, the Central Water Commission (CWC) has revealed in its latest monitoring report.

title: Amid Rising US Heat, Russia Offers India Bigger Oil Discounts: Report
content: The price of Russian oil has dropped to a discount of $3 to $4 per barrel for India, as New Delhi still bears the brunt of US tariffs.

title: Trump Vows To End Crime In "Most Dangerous City In The World" Chicago
content: US President Donald Trump vowed Tuesday to quickly resolve what he called "the crime problem" in Chicago, hinting at sending troops into what he branded the "most...

title: Schools Shut, 6 National Highways Blocked In Himachal Pradesh Due To Rain
content: Train service was suspended, 1,311 roads, including six national highways, were closed, and schools were shut as heavy rainfall on Tuesday sent normal life in disarray in Himachal Pradesh.

title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari Suspended For "Disrupting" Bengal Assembly Session
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari was suspended for the remainder of the special session of the West Bengal Assembly for allegedly disrupting proceedings convened to debate a motion condemning the alleged harassment of Bengali migrants
